intro: Trigonotis chengkouensis, commonly known as the Chengkou trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
